Reviews.Title: The Samsung Galaxy Tab SCH-1905-32GB,WIFI +4G (Verizon), 1o.1 in
Reviews.Author: candi
Reviews.Content: This product far exceeded my expectations. Once I got acclimated to using the touchscreen, I absolutely loved it! I enjoyed especially how fast it was, and how easy to use! It is a very user friendly product and would do well for first time users or  any technological level. I did not have a instruction manual, and was able to figure it out. I'm sure that with a manual, first time users would really learn the ins and outs of this product! But that shouldn't be a problem with so much information available on the internet, or even books like the Dummies series would give you the basics. I highly recommend this, and the features such as the WIFi/4G makes it an excellent travelling companion. It came with power cord etc, but I would recommend purchasing the automobile charger as well if you are on the road and planning to take it with you. So much less bulkier when you have to travel rather than a laptop. On a side note, I would also recommend a lightweight carrying case/ protector cover for it, to protect your investment, and for those of you who donot like using a touchscreen, a case with a keyboard is available too, though it makes the entire thing heavier than I like. Altogether a very satisfying purchase!

Reviews.Title: Warranty is Pain
Reviews.Author: Leon
Reviews.Content: Worked fine for 6 months, but....The tablet screen or operating system/hardware quit working and only gave me bright flashing lines on the display after only 6 months.  When I called Samsung, they did not want to honor the one year warranty since I bought it online and they believed it was not new (Amazon indicated the product was New) since it was manufactured over a year before the purchase.  BLUTEK, the seller, said they took the word of the supplier for the condition of the product.  Someone in this selling and buying scheme needs to take responsibility for the advertised condition of the product or warranty service.  Not happy about this situation, but don't know all the facts and cannot find out.  I hope someone steps up or I'll be leery of buying expensive electronics from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: ingo
Reviews.Author: ingo
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware this item has no warranty!!!!!!Nowhere does it say that on the sellers page, yet it came in a plain box and had no paperwork!!!!!When I called I was told by customer service "it didn't say there was a warranty".If you want a warranty it costs extra.Are we to assume that all products listed on Amazon do not have a warranty unless it says so????I thought amazon was better than that.

Reviews.Title: Better than iPad
Reviews.Author: Sugar+Rosie "Sugar+Rosie"
Reviews.Content: PROS:- BEST PART:  Easy data transfer.  Plug in USB and PC recognizes it as an external drive.  Just, select, copy & paste data.  You could copy your entire "My Document" file with just 3 clicks and it would show up the same on the Galaxy.  Apple requires you to use iTunes to transfer even pdf or jpeg files as do HP & other manufacturers.  Not so with the Samsung Galaxy.- Altho not an Apple product, even an easier transfer of iTunes music if you know where to locate them on your PC.  Samsung plays ACC & iTunes bought music without any conversion needed.- With USB adapter, can read external USB sticks & micro SD cards up to 32gb each.  Just plug 'em in, shows up as external drive on tablet under "My files", so can carry & access extra data limited only by the number of USB sticks or SD cards you carry with you.  Will even play iTunes music and show movies located on external drives.  But will NOT read larger 500GB external drives as those require high power.  Only USB sticks, & micro SD cards using special USB adpapter.  Didn't think this would be important as all my data is already backed up & stored "in the cloud" and have been able to access it and read it on any remote PC or notebook.  NOT SO WITH A TABLET, at least not the Galaxy.  This tab will definitely locate & find all files in the cloud BUT have to down each file to read it which means potentially high data useage charges.- Based on Android, Google's platform, so seamless integration with Google Maps (the gold standard of maps) and Gmail, contacts, calendar & Google Voice (which means you can send text messages from the tab).CONS:- iPad3 has higher resolution screen but you'll never notice unless both sitting side by side.- unknown tech support.  With an Apple store in every mall, easy to walk in and find any 20 yr old to show you how to use a feature or whether ur iPad is broken and needs repair.  Never heard of an Galaxy Tab or Android store than can offer the same support.- All Apple Apps have same interface, so once you learn one, you know how to use the others.  Each Google App is designed by someone else, so each has its own learning curve tho in most cases it's minor.- Can only print to certain Samsung printers.Only real peeve, on a PC, if you hover over an icon, a window will open telling you what that icon is for.  No such feature on the Galaxy Tab.  You have to remember from prior use.  But then think all tabs are the same.  Like smartphones.  You don't find out you hit the wrong menu button until it's too late.Great device for carrying and VIEWING data files on small external device.  NOT for intensive doc creation, working or even lengthy emails.  NOT A NOTEBOOK REPLACEMENT, but then don't know of a notebook that has built in 4G that'll allow you to read an email while traveling down the road.  All my files have been digital for over 10 years.  If I carry the USB sticks with me (which is easy to do & sync every night to keep the latest data with me) can access any document, client file or receipt wherever I am without ever connecting to the cloud & without lugging a 7 lb notebook.  Very light weight gizmo to access a database that in physical form would occupy a wall of filing cabinets.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet but ....
Reviews.Author: B. Parris
Reviews.Content: I am extreamly please with my Galaxy Tab.  It is very thin and light weight.  The picture quality is quite nice as well.  The battery seems to have plenty of life in WiFi mode.  I don't know how well it lasts running it in 4GL mode since I rarely if ever use the 4GL functionality.  That leads to my one serious issue with this tablet.Not only will the tablet will not boot up without a sim card it won't boot up without an activated sim card.  So if at some point I get tired of paying Verizon for the cell service on the tablet I won't be able to use my tablet.  I have a real problem with not being able to bypass the Celular fucntionality.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: Trudy Jarvis
Reviews.Content: love this android platform.  Very user friendly and all the great aps!  Lightweight and love the 4g from Verizon.  Was easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Almost a Five Star Tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Gary"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is excellent even though it is a 2011 model. The only problem i encountered was the lack of a Verizon 4g LTE micro sim. They are usually included with phone enabled tablets, but it is missing from this one. However, it only cost $9 and took 2 days for the sim to arrive.  If the sim had been included, or if the description had specifically stated a sim is NOT included, then it would have been a 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: G. Ricci
Reviews.Content: Great value. After reading about the 3 generations of Samsung Tablets, I got to thinking that with the 32GB of memory and the better cameras and flash, this 1st gen model was better than the newer ones and CHEAPER too. I think i was right. Yes, some of the apps are not compatible, but that is minor. The only one that bugs me so far is Google Keep. Not sure why it is not compatible. I had to get a SIM card from Verizon and the salesman also had a first gen tablet. When I told him my thoughts, he kind of grinned and agreed with me. The slightly slower processor will probably not even be noticed and with that much memory and better cameras.....

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: ilmod
Reviews.Content: I searched everywhere for a used tablet and they were all beat up or too expensive. This tablet showed up in almost perfect condidtion, arrived quickly and is working great. I took it to my local Verizon store, they put in a sim card for free and added the 4G service to my phone account for only $10 extra a month. Very happy with this purchase it does everything a tablet should for half price of a new one.

Reviews.Title: works as expected
Reviews.Author: michael t
Reviews.Content: Great tablet for the money, yes not as fast as second generation but allows me to access all my cloud based data. Love the 4G LTE it is very fast on down loads.
